value.text: Suyin Beifong (matriarch of the Metal Clan)

paragraphs.body: The Beifong family is a powerful and very influential ${link_0} ${link_1} family seated in ${link_2} and ${link_3}. Originally based in the town of ${link_4}, the Beifongs were renown for their wealth and good connections with other noble families like the Pang and Yum Soon Han families. To date, the family, whose symbol is a ${link_5}, is well respected and has great credibility in the Earth Kingdom.
paragraphs.text: The Beifong family is a powerful and very influential Earth Kingdom noble family seated in Zaofu and Republic City. Originally based in the town of Gaoling, the Beifongs were renown for their wealth and good connections with other noble families like the Pang and Yum Soon Han families. To date, the family, whose symbol is a flying boar, is well respected and has great credibility in the Earth Kingdom.

paragraphs.body: Important and influential members of the family include the co-founder of the ${link_0}, ${link_1}; his only daughter, Toph, a renowned earthbending master and the inventor of ${link_2}; her two daughters, ${link_3} and ${link_4}, the ${link_5} in ${link_6} and matriarch of the city of Zaofu, respectively; and ${link_7}, second-in-command of the ${link_8}.
paragraphs.text: Important and influential members of the family include the co-founder of the Earthen Fire Refinery, Lao Beifong; his only daughter, Toph, a renowned earthbending master and the inventor of metalbending; her two daughters, Lin and Suyin, the Chief of Police in Republic City and matriarch of the city of Zaofu, respectively; and Baatar Jr., second-in-command of the military of the Earth Empire.

paragraphs.body: The Beifong family lived in Gaoling, a village located within a mountain range in the southern Earth Kingdom. By the end of the ${link_0}, the family consisted of only three: Lao Beifong, his wife, ${link_1}, and their blind daughter, Toph. She was sheltered by her parents, who believed her blindness made her fragile, docile, and incapable of looking after herself, and as a result of these protective measures, no one outside of the family besides Master ${link_2} knew she even existed. Toph, resenting her parents' treatment, grew up to become tough, confrontational, and rebellious.
paragraphs.text: The Beifong family lived in Gaoling, a village located within a mountain range in the southern Earth Kingdom. By the end of the Hundred Year War, the family consisted of only three: Lao Beifong, his wife, Poppy, and their blind daughter, Toph. She was sheltered by her parents, who believed her blindness made her fragile, docile, and incapable of looking after herself, and as a result of these protective measures, no one outside of the family besides Master Yu knew she even existed. Toph, resenting her parents' treatment, grew up to become tough, confrontational, and rebellious.

paragraphs.body: The Beifong family lived in a mansion in ${link_0}.
paragraphs.text: The Beifong family lived in a mansion in Gaoling.

paragraphs.body: At the age of six, Toph ran away from home into a cave inhabited by ${link_0}. These ${link_1} were the first earthbenders and, according to Toph, she understood them and they understood her because they were both blind. She learned earthbending by imitating their movements and learned to "see" by using earthbending to detect minute vibrations through the ground with her bare feet. Although her father, Lao Beifong, later hired earthbending master Yu to instruct her, he did not teach her anything other than "basic forms and breathing exercises", unaware that she had already become very powerful. She became such a powerful bender that she secretly entered underground earthbending tournaments as "The Blind Bandit" and was the champion of ${link_2}.
paragraphs.text: At the age of six, Toph ran away from home into a cave inhabited by badgermoles. These creatures were the first earthbenders and, according to Toph, she understood them and they understood her because they were both blind. She learned earthbending by imitating their movements and learned to "see" by using earthbending to detect minute vibrations through the ground with her bare feet. Although her father, Lao Beifong, later hired earthbending master Yu to instruct her, he did not teach her anything other than "basic forms and breathing exercises", unaware that she had already become very powerful. She became such a powerful bender that she secretly entered underground earthbending tournaments as "The Blind Bandit" and was the champion of Earth Rumble VI.

paragraphs.body: After she was defeated by ${link_0} in the final stage of the tournament, he and his friends went to her house to request Toph be the ${link_1}'s earthbending teacher. She refused at first in order to keep her parents ignorant of her earthbending prowess, but that night Aang and Toph were kidnapped and held for ransom by ${link_2} and the other competitors from Earth Rumble VI. This resulted in Toph using her earthbending in front of her father in order to defeat the kidnappers and save Aang. Toph asked about teaching Aang earthbending, but her parents did not give their consent, opting instead to put their daughter under an even more stringent, twenty-four hour watch.
paragraphs.text: After she was defeated by Aang in the final stage of the tournament, he and his friends went to her house to request Toph be the Avatar's earthbending teacher. She refused at first in order to keep her parents ignorant of her earthbending prowess, but that night Aang and Toph were kidnapped and held for ransom by Xin Fu and the other competitors from Earth Rumble VI. This resulted in Toph using her earthbending in front of her father in order to defeat the kidnappers and save Aang. Toph asked about teaching Aang earthbending, but her parents did not give their consent, opting instead to put their daughter under an even more stringent, twenty-four hour watch.

paragraphs.body: That night, Toph escaped with Aang, ${link_0}, and ${link_1}, lying to them, saying that her parents had changed their minds. Lao and Poppy Beifong, thinking that the Avatar had kidnapped their daughter, hired Xin Fu and Master Yu to get their daughter back, an endeavor in which they did not succeed. Toph eventually contacted her family again on her own through means of a letter which she wrote with Katara's help and sent to them using Sokka's ${link_2}, ${link_3}.
paragraphs.text: That night, Toph escaped with Aang, Katara, and Sokka, lying to them, saying that her parents had changed their minds. Lao and Poppy Beifong, thinking that the Avatar had kidnapped their daughter, hired Xin Fu and Master Yu to get their daughter back, an endeavor in which they did not succeed. Toph eventually contacted her family again on her own through means of a letter which she wrote with Katara's help and sent to them using Sokka's messenger hawk, Hawky.

paragraphs.body: After Xin Fu and Yu gave up their search, Poppy greatly chastised Lao for the loss of their daughter, leading him to cast himself out. After the war, Lao partnered with a ${link_0} businessman, ${link_1}, to set up a factory on Earth Kingdom land rich in natural resources. This factory, the Earthen Fire Refinery, became the ${link_2}'s first international business venture and also employed both ${link_3} and nonbenders.
paragraphs.text: After Xin Fu and Yu gave up their search, Poppy greatly chastised Lao for the loss of their daughter, leading him to cast himself out. After the war, Lao partnered with a Fire Nation businessman, Loban, to set up a factory on Earth Kingdom land rich in natural resources. This factory, the Earthen Fire Refinery, became the world's first international business venture and also employed both benders and nonbenders.

paragraphs.body: In addition, Toph created a ${link_0} ${link_1} using her family name. This institution became popular due to the students' intervention at the ${link_2} and it was soon in need of expansion.
paragraphs.text: In addition, Toph created a metalbending academy using her family name. This institution became popular due to the students' intervention at the battle for Yu Dao and it was soon in need of expansion.

paragraphs.body: In 120 ${link_0}, Toph gave birth to a child, Lin, who became a metalbender like her mother. Lin kept her mother's last name and was identified as Chief Beifong during all of her days working in the police force of Republic City. Six years later, she had another daughter, Suyin, who also trained as a metalbender but was more rebellious than Lin, her half-sister. Following a bitter incident between her daughters, Toph sent Suyin to live with her grandparents. At the age of sixteen, Suyin left to travel the world, eventually deciding to settle down and start a family. She purchased a plot of Earth Kingdom land and founded the metal city of ${link_1}, hiring an architect, ${link_2}, who later became her husband. Together, they had five children: ${link_3}, ${link_4}, ${link_5}, ${link_6}. Toph would visit Zaofu from time to time before later traveling the world in search of enlightenment, eventually settling down in the ${link_7}.
paragraphs.text: In 120 AG, Toph gave birth to a child, Lin, who became a metalbender like her mother. Lin kept her mother's last name and was identified as Chief Beifong during all of her days working in the police force of Republic City. Six years later, she had another daughter, Suyin, who also trained as a metalbender but was more rebellious than Lin, her half-sister. Following a bitter incident between her daughters, Toph sent Suyin to live with her grandparents. At the age of sixteen, Suyin left to travel the world, eventually deciding to settle down and start a family. She purchased a plot of Earth Kingdom land and founded the metal city of Zaofu, hiring an architect, Baatar, who later became her husband. Together, they had five children: Baatar Jr., Huan, Opal, Wei, and Wing. Toph would visit Zaofu from time to time before later traveling the world in search of enlightenment, eventually settling down in the Foggy Swamp.

paragraphs.body: As a result of the ${link_0} causing ${link_1}, Baatar Jr. joined Zaofu's former guard captain, ${link_2}, to reunite the kingdom by force, resulting in an estrangement from his mother, who believed it was a power grab. In the intervening three years, Baatar Jr. and Kuvira got engaged.
paragraphs.text: As a result of the Red Lotus causing anarchy in the Earth Kingdom, Baatar Jr. joined Zaofu's former guard captain, Kuvira, to reunite the kingdom by force, resulting in an estrangement from his mother, who believed it was a power grab. In the intervening three years, Baatar Jr. and Kuvira got engaged.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} used the ${link_1} in order to secure four tickets for the ${link_2}.
paragraphs.text: Toph used the Beifong family document in order to secure four tickets for the Earth Kingdom ferry.

paragraphs.body: The Beifong family is influential and greatly respected in the Earth Kingdom, as indicated by Toph's ability to use the ${link_0} in gaining passage for herself and ${link_1} on the ${link_2} at ${link_3}. Their wealth had been displayed when they offered gold to the bounty hunters to hunt down their daughter. The documents read "土國頭等護照 北方拓芙", meaning "Earth Kingdom First Class Passport - Toph Beifong". Their influence did not appear to extend to the ${link_4} of ${link_5}, as the documents did not grant Toph and Katara access to ${link_6}'s party.
paragraphs.text: The Beifong family is influential and greatly respected in the Earth Kingdom, as indicated by Toph's ability to use the family seal in gaining passage for herself and her friends on the ferry at Full Moon Bay. Their wealth had been displayed when they offered gold to the bounty hunters to hunt down their daughter. The documents read "土國頭等護照 北方拓芙", meaning "Earth Kingdom First Class Passport - Toph Beifong". Their influence did not appear to extend to the Upper Ring of Ba Sing Se, as the documents did not grant Toph and Katara access to Bosco's party.

paragraphs.body: After the Hundred Year War, the Beifong family, primarily due to Toph, and eventually, her descendants' accomplishments, was respected for its contribution to the innovation of their nation's bending art, such as seismic sense and more importantly, the invention of metalbending. Lin followed the footsteps of her mother in the police force, while Suyin single-handedly built an entire city out of metal.
paragraphs.text: After the Hundred Year War, the Beifong family, primarily due to Toph, and eventually, her descendants' accomplishments, was respected for its contribution to the innovation of their nation's bending art, such as seismic sense and more importantly, the invention of metalbending. Lin followed the footsteps of her mother in the police force, while Suyin single-handedly built an entire city out of metal.

paragraphs.body: The Beifong family had such a good standard in the Earth Kingdom, that the name demanded respect and credibility. ${link_0} ${link_1} and ${link_2} attempted to use this to their advantage to convince Suyin to restore order in the kingdom, though she declined.
paragraphs.text: The Beifong family had such a good standard in the Earth Kingdom, that the name demanded respect and credibility. President Raiko and Tenzin attempted to use this to their advantage to convince Suyin to restore order in the kingdom, though she declined.
